Description: Glass lentoid flask. Clear dark blue, with opaque white, opaque light blue and opaque orange trails. Cylindrical neck, meeting shoulder in gentle curve; lentoid body, rounded bottom. On shoulder two lower handle-attachments for vertical handles that would rise to meet neck below rim. On neck, band of feather pattern in three colours; on body, similar band, bounded above and below by single horizontal white trails. Core-formed and tooled, trails marvered and combed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: BM Glass Murray et al. 1900, 23, fig. 63. Fossing 1940, 29. Astrom 1967, 59, 126 (=id. 1972, 531, 598). Nolte 1968. 112. 117 no. 30. There is only one example, which comes from Enkomi, Cyprus. Fragmentary as it is, there can be no doubt that it belongs to Nolte's form VII, a (Nolte 1968, 172) resembling particularly the numerous examples in her Werkkreis 4 (ibid. 115-18, pls. xviii-xix, nos. 19-28, 32-5), along with which it is listed as no. 30. Like the last two classes (BM Glass 1-7), this piece was almost certainly made it Egypt and must belong to the late 18th or the 19th dynasty (mid-14th to late 13th century BC.)
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (8)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 87)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.23-4,35, Fig 63)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 152, Flask No.1)
Condition: Rim, most of neck and handles, and much of lower body missing. Broken and mended and partially restored in plaster. Milky weathering and spots of brown pitting in places; other areas retain pristine sheen. Some lime-encrustation.
